basics.name: Viswonathan Manoranjan
basics.summary: Researcher passionate about advancing knowledge through rigorous research and innovation.

work.summary: Developed GenAI-powered tools, microservices, and automation pipelines. Achieved 35% productivity improvement and 90% workload reduction through innovative solutions.
highlights: Accelerated developer productivity by ~35% by deploying GenAI-powered VS Code extensions
Handled 5K+ concurrent users with <200 ms latency using Java/Spring Boot microservices
Enhanced user engagement by 25% by migrating legacy applications to React micro-frontends
Reduced manual workload by 90% through automated batch job pipelines

work.summary: Conducted research on fairness-aware machine learning and personality computing under Dr. Hanan Salam and Dr. Oya Celiktutan.
highlights: Improved fairness by ~35% in multi-modal ML models using novel fairness loss functions
Increased prediction accuracy by 15% through personalized AutoKeras CNN architectures
Co-authored peer-reviewed papers in IEEE TAFFC, ACMM, and PMLR

work.position: Intern Analyst, Consumer and Small Business Banking
work.summary: Developed real-time analytics pipelines and observability dashboards using modern cloud technologies.
highlights: Reduced event processing latency to 190 ms (40% decrease) for 10K+ concurrent users
Tripled telemetry coverage by building React observability dashboards
Enhanced reliability through containerized microservices and multi-region deployments

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
education.area: Master of Science in Computer Science
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Engineering

publications.name: Towards Generalised and Incremental Bias Mitigation in Personality Computing
publications.summary: Presents novel approaches for generalized and incremental bias mitigation in personality computing systems.

publications.name: Optimized Reversible Cellular Automata Based Clustering
publications.publisher: Cellular Automata and Discrete Complex Systems (AUTOMATA 2023)
publications.summary: Explores the use of reversible cellular automata for efficient clustering algorithms.

publications.name: Generalised Bias Mitigation for Personality Computing
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 1st International Workshop on MRAC 2023, ACM MM conference
publications.summary: Introduces generalized bias mitigation techniques for personality computing.

publications.name: Learning Personalised Models for Automatic Self-Reported Personality Recognition
publications.publisher: Understanding Social Behavior in Dyadic and Small Group Interactions, PMLR 173:53-73
publications.summary: Develops personalized deep learning architectures for automatic personality recognition.
